snippet: The approach illustrated the European Union’s strategy of trying to rein in Israeli actions that undermine the Middle East peace process, while maintaining good relations with Israel.
abstract: European Union designates Hezbollah a terrorist organization, illustrating the bloc's strategy of trying to rein in Israeli actions that undermine Middle East peace process, while maintaining good relations with Israel.

byline.original: By JAMES KANTER and JODI RUDOREN
byline.contributor: James Kanter reported from Brussels, and Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem. Steven Erlanger contributed reporting from Paris, and Michael R. Gordon from Amman, Jordan.

lead_paragraph: The approach illustrated the European Union’s strategy of trying to rein in Israeli actions that undermine the Middle East peace process, while maintaining good relations with Israel.

headline.main: Europe’s Carrot-and-Stick Approach to Israel Includes Blacklisting Hezbollah
headline.print_headline: Europe’s Carrot-and-Stick Approach to Israel Includes Blacklisting Hezbollah

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
